newCamRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses landlord for excess real property taxes over the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
newCamRules.exactLanguage: Landlord agrees to pay all real property taxes and special assessments (collectively referred to herein as "Taxes") that accrue against the Premises, and/or the Land and/or improvements of which the Premises are a part. Property taxes incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the taxes on the property during the "Base Year" will be passed through to building tenants based on a pro‑rata square footage basis.
newCamRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay the portion of any property tax that exceeds the 2016 Base Year amount, proportional to the tenant’s share of rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant's proportionate share equals the Premises rentable square feet divided by the total Building rentable square feet, as adjusted per the Premises paragraph.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage:
Share
Broker or Agent:
rentable square feet in the Premises by (ii) the 226,468 total rentable square feet
in the Building. Tenant's Proportionate Share shall be adjusted in accordance with
the Premises paragraph above.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will pay CAM expenses based on this calculated share of the Building’s rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses landlord for excess real property taxes over the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord agrees to pay all real property taxes and special assessments (collectively referred to herein as "Taxes") that accrue against the Premises, and/or the Land and/or improvements of which the Premises are a part. Property taxes incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the taxes on the property during the "Base Year" will be passed through to building tenants based on a pro‑rata square footage basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay the portion of any property tax that exceeds the 2016 Base Year amount, proportional to the tenant’s share of rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant liable for personal property/fixtures taxes paid by landlord upon demand.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall be liable for all taxes levied or assessed against any personal property or fixtures placed in the Premises. If any such taxes are levied or assessed against Landlord or Landlord's property and (i) Landlord pays the same or (ii) the assessed value of Landlord's property is increased by inclusion of such personal property and fixtures and Landlord pays the increased taxes, then, upon demand Tenant shall pay to Landlord such taxes.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reimburse landlord for any taxes on personal property or fixtures that landlord pays for, upon demand.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays excess operating expenses above the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Operating expenses (as defined herein) incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the operating expenses on the Building for the Base Year (2016) (the \"Base Year\"\') will be passed through to the Building tenants on a prorata basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is responsible for its proportional share of any operating expenses that exceed the 2016 Base Year amount.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant may inspect books of excess property tax invoices within 180 days.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall have a right to inspect the books and records of the property within one hundred eighty (180) days of receipt of such invoice with respect to such account.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant has a limited audit window for reviewing tax pass‑through invoices, after which rights are waived.

newCamRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses Landlord for any underpayment of its proportionate share of operating expenses.
newCamRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall promptly reimburse Landlord for any underpayment of Tenant's Proportionate Share of such Operating Expenses.
newCamRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay Landlord for any shortfall in its CAM payment, potentially increasing cash flow obligations.

newCamRules.ruleSummary: If operating expenses overstatement exceeds 5%, Landlord reimburses tenant for audit cost.
newCamRules.exactLanguage: In the event that Tenant's Review indicates that Operating Expenses were overstated by more than five percent (5%}, then Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for the reasonable cost of such audit.
newCamRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

newCamRules.ruleSummary: Repairs to roof, foundation, and structural components are excluded from operating expenses and tenant CAM obligations.
newCamRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
newCamRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific repairs under CAM, reducing potential liability.

newCamRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays $50 per hour for maintenance personnel when issue is tenant‑responsible.
newCamRules.exactLanguage: Landlord shall charge, and Tenant shall pay, fifty dollars ($50.00) per hour, with a one hour minimum, for work performed by such personnel.
newCamRules.tenantImpact: Tenant incurs additional hourly charges for maintenance work it is responsible for, adding to operating cost exposure.

ambiguities.description: Bracket formatting error in the percentage notation "(5%}" may cause confusion in interpreting the audit threshold.
ambiguities.potentialIssue: Unclear if the threshold is 5% or another value due to typographical error.
ambiguities.recommendedAction: Clarify the intended percentage and correct typographical error.

ambiguities.description: It is ambiguous whether the $50 hourly maintenance personnel fee is included in CAM operating expenses or considered a separate administrative cost.
ambiguities.potentialIssue: Could affect tenant's ability to classify and audit this expense as CAM or a separate line item.
ambiguities.recommendedAction: Request explicit definition of whether this fee is part of Operating Expenses.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Excludes a list of expenses from tenant's CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Operating Expenses shall not include any of the following: (i) expenses for capital improvements except as expressly provided in this Section 4; (ii) costs (in excess of Landlord's insurance deductible) of repairs, restoration, replacements or other work occasioned by fire, windstorm or other casualty of an insurable nature (whether such destruction be total or partial), or the negligence or intentional tort of Landlord, or any subsidiary or affiliate of Landlord, or any representative, employee or agent of same; (iii) interest and amortization of funds borrowed by Landlord, whether secured or unsecured, and other financing costs; (iv) depreciation of the Building; (v) leasing commissions; (vi) costs, fines, interest, penalties, legal fees or costs of litigation incurred due to the late payments of taxes, utility bills and other costs incurred by Landlord's failure to make such payments when due; (vii) costs incurred (less cost of recovery) for any items to the extent covered by a manufacturer's, materialmen's, vendor's or contractor's warranty; (viii) income, excess profits, franchise taxes or other such taxes imposed on or measured by the income of Landlord from the operation of the Building; (ix) costs of Landlord's defense of lawsuits against Landlord and any judgments or costs of settlement; (x) legal fees and other costs (including prepayment of any indebtedness) incurred in connection with any mortgaging, financing, refinancing, sale, change of ownership or entering into or extending or modifying any financing, 5
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will not be responsible for the listed items, reducing its CAM exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Caps annual increase of controllable operating expenses at 5%.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance) shall not increase by more than five percent (5%) annually following Tenant's Base Year.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Limits tenant’s exposure to uncontrollable inflation in controllable CAM items to a maximum 5% per year.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays monthly Additional Rent for estimated annual increases in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: For the calendar year commencing on January 1st of the first calendar year after the Base Year and for each calendar year thereafter during the Term, Landlord shall estimate the amount the Operating Expenses shall increase for such calendar year above the Operating Expenses incurred during the Base Year. Landlord shall send to Tenant a written statement of the amount of Tenant's Proportionate Share of any estimated increase in Operating Expenses and Tenant shall pay to Landlord, monthly as Additional Rent, Tenant's prorata share of such increase in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must make monthly payments for projected increases, providing predictable cash flow but obligating payment before actual reconciliation.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Annual reconciliation of actual Operating Expenses with a 30‑day payment window.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Within ninety (90) days after the end of each calendar year, Landlord shall send an annual statement of Operating Expenses, which shall be accounted for and reported in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (the "Annual Statement") to Tenant. Pursuant to the Annual Statement, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Additional Rent in a lump sum as owed or Landlord shall adjust Tenant's Rent payments if Landlord owes Tenant a credit, such payment or adjustment to be made within thirty (30) days after the Annual Statement is received by Tenant.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reconcile and pay any outstanding amount or receive a rent adjustment within 30 days of receiving the Annual Statement.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Base Year for CAM calculations as 2016.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: The term "Operating Expense" as used herein means ... The term "Base Year" for tax and operating expense calculations is defined as the calendar year 2016.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant’s CAM calculations reference the 2016 Base Year for comparisons and adjustments.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Controllable Operating Expenses as all except taxes and insurance.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance)
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Clarifies which expenses are subject to the 5% cap and which are non‑controllable.

allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay Landlord for any shortfall in its CAM payment, potentially increasing cash flow obligations.

allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific repairs under CAM, reducing potential liability.

ambiguities.description: Incomplete clause "Operating Expenses shall be adjusted to reflect the Operating" on page 8/9.
ambiguities.potentialIssue: Unclear how adjustments are calculated; could affect tenant CAM calculations.
ambiguities.recommendedAction: Seek clarification or amendment specifying adjustment methodology.

ambiguities.description: Bracket formatting error in the percentage notation "(5%}" may cause confusion in interpreting the audit threshold.
ambiguities.potentialIssue: Unclear if the threshold is 5% or another value due to typographical error.
ambiguities.recommendedAction: Clarify the intended percentage and correct typographical error.

ambiguities.description: It is ambiguous whether the $50 hourly maintenance personnel fee is included in CAM operating expenses or considered a separate administrative cost.
ambiguities.potentialIssue: Could affect tenant's ability to classify and audit this expense as CAM or a separate line item.
ambiguities.recommendedAction: Request explicit definition of whether this fee is part of Operating Expenses.

tenantConcerns.description: Audit rights for excess property taxes are limited to 180 days, and no audit right is provided for operating expenses.
Audit rights limited to 180 days for excess property taxes; no audit right for operating expenses.
Lack of clear methodology for adjusting Operating Expenses may increase tenant exposure.

provisionsSpanningToNextPage.partialText: Operating Expenses shall be adjusted to reflect the Operating
provisionsSpanningToNextPage.expectedContinuation: Full adjustment methodology for Operating Expenses

keyTenantProtections: Clear proportionate share calculation
Tenant's right to inspect excess tax books within 180 days
Tenant’s right to recover audit costs if overstatement >5%
keyTenantExposures: Limited audit rights for operating expenses
Incomplete adjustment language for operating expenses

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant's proportionate share equals the Premises rentable square feet divided by the total Building rentable square feet, as adjusted per the Premises paragraph.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage:
Share
Broker or Agent:
rentable square feet in the Premises by (ii) the 226,468 total rentable square feet
in the Building. Tenant's Proportionate Share shall be adjusted in accordance with
the Premises paragraph above.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will pay CAM expenses based on this calculated share of the Building’s rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses landlord for excess real property taxes over the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord agrees to pay all real property taxes and special assessments (collectively referred to herein as "Taxes") that accrue against the Premises, and/or the Land and/or improvements of which the Premises are a part. Property taxes incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the taxes on the property during the "Base Year" will be passed through to building tenants based on a pro‑rata square footage basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay the portion of any property tax that exceeds the 2016 Base Year amount, proportional to the tenant’s share of rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant liable for personal property/fixtures taxes paid by landlord upon demand.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall be liable for all taxes levied or assessed against any personal property or fixtures placed in the Premises. If any such taxes are levied or assessed against Landlord or Landlord's property and (i) Landlord pays the same or (ii) the assessed value of Landlord's property is increased by inclusion of such personal property and fixtures and Landlord pays the increased taxes, then, upon demand Tenant shall pay to Landlord such taxes.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reimburse landlord for any taxes on personal property or fixtures that landlord pays for, upon demand.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays excess operating expenses above the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Operating expenses (as defined herein) incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the operating expenses on the Building for the Base Year (2016) (the \"Base Year\"\') will be passed through to the Building tenants on a prorata basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is responsible for its proportional share of any operating expenses that exceed the 2016 Base Year amount.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant may inspect books of excess property tax invoices within 180 days.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall have a right to inspect the books and records of the property within one hundred eighty (180) days of receipt of such invoice with respect to such account.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant has a limited audit window for reviewing tax pass‑through invoices, after which rights are waived.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Excludes a list of expenses from tenant's CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Operating Expenses shall not include any of the following: (i) expenses for capital improvements except as expressly provided in this Section 4; (ii) costs (in excess of Landlord's insurance deductible) of repairs, restoration, replacements or other work occasioned by fire, windstorm or other casualty of an insurable nature (whether such destruction be total or partial), or the negligence or intentional tort of Landlord, or any subsidiary or affiliate of Landlord, or any representative, employee or agent of same; (iii) interest and amortization of funds borrowed by Landlord, whether secured or unsecured, and other financing costs; (iv) depreciation of the Building; (v) leasing commissions; (vi) costs, fines, interest, penalties, legal fees or costs of litigation incurred due to the late payments of taxes, utility bills and other costs incurred by Landlord's failure to make such payments when due; (vii) costs incurred (less cost of recovery) for any items to the extent covered by a manufacturer's, materialmen's, vendor's or contractor's warranty; (viii) income, excess profits, franchise taxes or other such taxes imposed on or measured by the income of Landlord from the operation of the Building; (ix) costs of Landlord's defense of lawsuits against Landlord and any judgments or costs of settlement; (x) legal fees and other costs (including prepayment of any indebtedness) incurred in connection with any mortgaging, financing, refinancing, sale, change of ownership or entering into or extending or modifying any financing, 5
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will not be responsible for the listed items, reducing its CAM exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Caps annual increase of controllable operating expenses at 5%.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance) shall not increase by more than five percent (5%) annually following Tenant's Base Year.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Limits tenant’s exposure to uncontrollable inflation in controllable CAM items to a maximum 5% per year.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays monthly Additional Rent for estimated annual increases in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: For the calendar year commencing on January 1st of the first calendar year after the Base Year and for each calendar year thereafter during the Term, Landlord shall estimate the amount the Operating Expenses shall increase for such calendar year above the Operating Expenses incurred during the Base Year. Landlord shall send to Tenant a written statement of the amount of Tenant's Proportionate Share of any estimated increase in Operating Expenses and Tenant shall pay to Landlord, monthly as Additional Rent, Tenant's prorata share of such increase in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must make monthly payments for projected increases, providing predictable cash flow but obligating payment before actual reconciliation.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Annual reconciliation of actual Operating Expenses with a 30‑day payment window.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Within ninety (90) days after the end of each calendar year, Landlord shall send an annual statement of Operating Expenses, which shall be accounted for and reported in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (the "Annual Statement") to Tenant. Pursuant to the Annual Statement, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Additional Rent in a lump sum as owed or Landlord shall adjust Tenant's Rent payments if Landlord owes Tenant a credit, such payment or adjustment to be made within thirty (30) days after the Annual Statement is received by Tenant.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reconcile and pay any outstanding amount or receive a rent adjustment within 30 days of receiving the Annual Statement.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Base Year for CAM calculations as 2016.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: The term "Operating Expense" as used herein means ... The term "Base Year" for tax and operating expense calculations is defined as the calendar year 2016.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant’s CAM calculations reference the 2016 Base Year for comparisons and adjustments.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Controllable Operating Expenses as all except taxes and insurance.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance)
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Clarifies which expenses are subject to the 5% cap and which are non‑controllable.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses Landlord for any underpayment of its proportionate share of operating expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall promptly reimburse Landlord for any underpayment of Tenant's Proportionate Share of such Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay Landlord for any shortfall in its CAM payment, potentially increasing cash flow obligations.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: If operating expenses overstatement exceeds 5%, Landlord reimburses tenant for audit cost.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: In the event that Tenant's Review indicates that Operating Expenses were overstated by more than five percent (5%}, then Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for the reasonable cost of such audit.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Repairs to roof, foundation, and structural components are excluded from operating expenses and tenant CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific repairs under CAM, reducing potential liability.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays $50 per hour for maintenance personnel when issue is tenant‑responsible.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord shall charge, and Tenant shall pay, fifty dollars ($50.00) per hour, with a one hour minimum, for work performed by such personnel.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant incurs additional hourly charges for maintenance work it is responsible for, adding to operating cost exposure.

keyTenantProtections: Clear proportionate share calculation
Tenant's right to inspect excess tax books within 180 days
Tenant’s right to recover audit costs if overstatement >5%
keyTenantExposures: Limited audit rights for operating expenses

allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall have a right to inspect the books and records of the property within one hundred eighty (180) days of receipt of such invoice with respect to such account.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant has a limited audit window for reviewing tax pass‑through invoices, after which rights are waived.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Excludes a list of expenses from tenant's CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Operating Expenses shall not include any of the following: (i) expenses for capital improvements except as expressly provided in this Section 4; (ii) costs (in excess of Landlord's insurance deductible) of repairs, restoration, replacements or other work occasioned by fire, windstorm or other casualty of an insurable nature (whether such destruction be total or partial), or the negligence or intentional tort of Landlord, or any subsidiary or affiliate of Landlord, or any representative, employee or agent of same; (iii) interest and amortization of funds borrowed by Landlord, whether secured or unsecured, and other financing costs; (iv) depreciation of the Building; (v) leasing commissions; (vi) costs, fines, interest, penalties, legal fees or costs of litigation incurred due to the late payments of taxes, utility bills and other costs incurred by Landlord's failure to make such payments when due; (vii) costs incurred (less cost of recovery) for any items to the extent covered by a manufacturer's, materialmen's, vendor's or contractor's warranty; (viii) income, excess profits, franchise taxes or other such taxes imposed on or measured by the income of Landlord from the operation of the Building; (ix) costs of Landlord's defense of lawsuits against Landlord and any judgments or costs of settlement; (x) legal fees and other costs (including prepayment of any indebtedness) incurred in connection with any mortgaging, financing, refinancing, sale, change of ownership or entering into or extending or modifying any financing, 5
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will not be responsible for the listed items, reducing its CAM exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Caps annual increase of controllable operating expenses at 5%.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance) shall not increase by more than five percent (5%) annually following Tenant's Base Year.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Limits tenant’s exposure to uncontrollable inflation in controllable CAM items to a maximum 5% per year.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays monthly Additional Rent for estimated annual increases in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: For the calendar year commencing on January 1st of the first calendar year after the Base Year and for each calendar year thereafter during the Term, Landlord shall estimate the amount the Operating Expenses shall increase for such calendar year above the Operating Expenses incurred during the Base Year. Landlord shall send to Tenant a written statement of the amount of Tenant's Proportionate Share of any estimated increase in Operating Expenses and Tenant shall pay to Landlord, monthly as Additional Rent, Tenant's prorata share of such increase in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must make monthly payments for projected increases, providing predictable cash flow but obligating payment before actual reconciliation.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Annual reconciliation of actual Operating Expenses with a 30‑day payment window.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Within ninety (90) days after the end of each calendar year, Landlord shall send an annual statement of Operating Expenses, which shall be accounted for and reported in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (the "Annual Statement") to Tenant. Pursuant to the Annual Statement, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Additional Rent in a lump sum as owed or Landlord shall adjust Tenant's Rent payments if Landlord owes Tenant a credit, such payment or adjustment to be made within thirty (30) days after the Annual Statement is received by Tenant.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reconcile and pay any outstanding amount or receive a rent adjustment within 30 days of receiving the Annual Statement.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Base Year for CAM calculations as 2016.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: The term "Operating Expense" as used herein means ... The term "Base Year" for tax and operating expense calculations is defined as the calendar year 2016.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant’s CAM calculations reference the 2016 Base Year for comparisons and adjustments.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Controllable Operating Expenses as all except taxes and insurance.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance)
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Clarifies which expenses are subject to the 5% cap and which are non‑controllable.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses Landlord for any underpayment of its proportionate share of operating expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall promptly reimburse Landlord for any underpayment of Tenant's Proportionate Share of such Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay Landlord for any shortfall in its CAM payment, potentially increasing cash flow obligations.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: If operating expenses overstatement exceeds 5%, Landlord reimburses tenant for audit cost.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: In the event that Tenant's Review indicates that Operating Expenses were overstated by more than five percent (5%}, then Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for the reasonable cost of such audit.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Repairs to roof, foundation, and structural components are excluded from operating expenses and tenant CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific…

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays $50 per hour for maintenance personnel when issue is tenant‑responsible.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord shall charge, and Tenant shall pay, fifty dollars ($50.00) per hour, with a one hour minimum, for work performed by such personnel.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant incurs additional hourly charges for maintenance work it is responsible for, adding to operating cost exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses landlord for excess real property taxes over the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord agrees to pay all real property taxes and special assessments (collectively referred to herein as "Taxes") that accrue against the Premises, and/or the Land and/or improvements of which the Premises are a part. Property taxes incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the taxes on the property during the "Base Year" will be passed through to building tenants based on a pro‑rata square footage basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay the portion of any property tax that exceeds the 2016 Base Year amount, proportional to the tenant’s share of rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant liable for personal property/fixtures taxes paid by landlord upon demand.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall be liable for all taxes levied or assessed against any personal property or fixtures placed in the Premises. If any such taxes are levied or assessed against Landlord or Landlord's property and (i) Landlord pays the same or (ii) the assessed value of Landlord's property is increased by inclusion of such personal property and fixtures and Landlord pays the increased taxes, then, upon demand Tenant shall pay to Landlord such taxes.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reimburse landlord for any taxes on personal property or fixtures that landlord pays for, upon demand.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays excess operating expenses above the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Operating expenses (as defined herein) incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the operating expenses on the Building for the Base Year (2016) (the "Base Year") will be passed through to the Building tenants on a prorata basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is responsible for its proportional share of any operating expenses that exceed the 2016 Base Year amount.

allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: In the event that Tenant's Review indicates that Operating Expenses were overstated by more than five percent (5%}, then Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for the reasonable cost of such audit.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Repairs to roof, foundation, and structural components are excluded from operating expenses and tenant CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific repairs under CAM, reducing potential liability.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays $50 per hour for maintenance personnel when issue is tenant‑responsible.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord shall charge, and Tenant shall pay, fifty dollars ($50.00) per hour, with a one hour minimum, for work performed by such personnel.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant incurs additional hourly charges for maintenance work it is responsible for, adding to operating cost exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant's proportionate share equals the Premises rentable square feet divided by the total Building rentable square feet, as adjusted per the Premises paragraph.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage:
Share
Broker or Agent:
rentable square feet in the Premises by (ii) the 226,468 total rentable square feet
in the Building. Tenant's Proportionate Share shall be adjusted in accordance with
the Premises paragraph above.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will pay CAM expenses based on this calculated share of the Building’s rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses landlord for excess real property taxes over the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord agrees to pay all real property taxes and special assessments (collectively referred to herein as "Taxes") that accrue against the Premises, and/or the Land and/or improvements of which the Premises are a part. Property taxes incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the taxes on the property during the "Base Year" will be passed through to building tenants based on a pro‑rata square footage basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay the portion of any property tax that exceeds the 2016 Base Year amount, proportional to the tenant’s share of rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant liable for personal property/fixtures taxes paid by landlord upon demand.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall be liable for all taxes levied or assessed against any personal property or fixtures placed in the Premises. If any such taxes are levied or assessed against Landlord or Landlord's property and (i) Landlord pays the same or (ii) the assessed value of Landlord's property is increased by inclusion of such personal property and fixtures and Landlord pays the increased taxes, then, upon demand Tenant shall pay to Landlord such taxes.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reimburse landlord for any taxes on personal property or fixtures that landlord pays for, upon demand.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays excess operating expenses above the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Operating expenses (as defined herein) incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the operating expenses on the Building for the Base Year (2016) (the \"Base Year\"\') will be passed through to the Building tenants on a prorata basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is responsible for its proportional share of any operating expenses that exceed the 2016 Base Year amount.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant may inspect books of excess property tax invoices within 180 days.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall have a right to inspect the books and records of the property within one hundred eighty (180) days of receipt of such invoice with respect to such account.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant has a limited audit window for reviewing tax pass‑through invoices, after which rights are waived.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Excludes a list of expenses from tenant's CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Operating Expenses shall not include any of the following: (i) expenses for capital improvements except as expressly provided in this Section 4; (ii) costs (in excess of Landlord's insurance deductible) of repairs, restoration, replacements or other work occasioned by fire, windstorm or other casualty of an insurable nature (whether such destruction be total or partial), or the negligence or intentional tort of Landlord, or any subsidiary or affiliate of Landlord, or any representative, employee or agent of same; (iii) interest and amortization of funds borrowed by Landlord, whether secured or unsecured, and other financing costs; (iv) depreciation of the Building; (v) leasing commissions; (vi) costs, fines, interest, penalties, legal fees or costs of litigation incurred due to the late payments of taxes, utility bills and other costs incurred by Landlord's failure to make such payments when due; (vii) costs incurred (less cost of recovery) for any items to the extent covered by a manufacturer's, materialmen's, vendor's or contractor's warranty; (viii) income, excess profits, franchise taxes or other such taxes imposed on or measured by the income of Landlord from the operation of the Building; (ix) costs of Landlord's defense of lawsuits against Landlord and any judgments or costs of settlement; (x) legal fees and other costs (including prepayment of any indebtedness) incurred in connection with any mortgaging, financing, refinancing, sale, change of ownership or entering into or extending or modifying any financing, 5
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will not be responsible for the listed items, reducing its CAM exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Caps annual increase of controllable operating expenses at 5%.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance) shall not increase by more than five percent (5%) annually following Tenant's Base Year.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Limits tenant’s exposure to uncontrollable inflation in controllable CAM items to a maximum 5% per year.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays monthly Additional Rent for estimated annual increases in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: For the calendar year commencing on January 1st of the first calendar year after the Base Year and for each calendar year thereafter during the Term, Landlord shall estimate the amount the Operating Expenses shall increase for such calendar year above the Operating Expenses incurred during the Base Year. Landlord shall send to Tenant a written statement of the amount of Tenant's Proportionate Share of any estimated increase in Operating Expenses and Tenant shall pay to Landlord, monthly as Additional Rent, Tenant's prorata share of such increase in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must make monthly payments for projected increases, providing predictable cash flow but obligating payment before actual reconciliation.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Annual reconciliation of actual Operating Expenses with a 30‑day payment window.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Within ninety (90) days after the end of each calendar year, Landlord shall send an annual statement of Operating Expenses, which shall be accounted for and reported in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (the "Annual Statement") to Tenant. Pursuant to the Annual Statement, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Additional Rent in a lump sum as owed or Landlord shall adjust Tenant's Rent payments if Landlord owes Tenant a credit, such payment or adjustment to be made within thirty (30) days after the Annual Statement is received by Tenant.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reconcile and pay any outstanding amount or receive a rent adjustment within 30 days of receiving the Annual Statement.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Base Year for CAM calculations as 2016.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: The term "Operating Expense" as used herein means ... The term "Base Year" for tax and operating expense calculations is defined as the calendar year 2016.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant’s CAM calculations reference the 2016 Base Year for comparisons and adjustments.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Controllable Operating Expenses as all except taxes and insurance.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance)
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Clarifies which expenses are subject to the 5% cap and which are non‑controllable.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses Landlord for any underpayment of its proportionate share of operating expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall promptly reimburse Landlord for any underpayment of Tenant's Proportionate Share of such Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay Landlord for any shortfall in its CAM payment, potentially increasing cash flow obligations.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: If operating expenses overstatement exceeds 5%, Landlord reimburses tenant for audit cost.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: In the event that Tenant's Review indicates that Operating Expenses were overstated by more than five percent (5%}, then Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for the reasonable cost of such audit.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific repairs under CAM, reducing potential liability.

allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord shall charge, and Tenant shall pay, fifty dollars ($50.00) per hour, with a one hour minimum, for work performed by such personnel.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant incurs additional hourly charges for maintenance work it is responsible for, adding to operating cost exposure.

Property taxes incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the taxes on the property during the "Base Year" will be passed through to building tenants based on a pro‑rata square footage basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay the portion of any property tax that exceeds the 2016 Base Year amount, proportional to the tenant’s share of rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant liable for personal property/fixtures taxes paid by landlord upon demand.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall be liable for all taxes levied or assessed against any personal property or fixtures placed in the Premises. If any such taxes are levied or assessed against Landlord or Landlord's property and (i) Landlord pays the same or (ii) the assessed value of Landlord's property is increased by inclusion of such personal property and fixtures and Landlord pays the increased taxes, then, upon demand Tenant shall pay to Landlord such taxes.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reimburse landlord for any taxes on personal property or fixtures that landlord pays for, upon demand.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays excess operating expenses above the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Operating expenses (as defined herein) incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the operating expenses on the Building for the Base Year (2016) (the "Base Year") will be passed through to the Building tenants on a prorata basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is responsible for its proportional share of any operating expenses that exceed the 2016 Base Year amount.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant may inspect books of excess property tax invoices within 180 days.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall have a right to inspect the books and records of the property within one hundred eighty (180) days of receipt of such invoice with respect to such account.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant has a limited audit window for reviewing tax pass‑through invoices, after which rights are waived.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Excludes a list of expenses from tenant's CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Operating Expenses shall not include any of the following: (i) expenses for capital improvements except as expressly provided in this Section 4; (ii) costs (in excess of Landlord's insurance deductible) of repairs, restoration, replacements or other work occasioned by fire, windstorm or other casualty of an insurable nature (whether such destruction be total or partial), or the negligence or intentional tort of Landlord, or any subsidiary or affiliate of Landlord, or any representative, employee or agent of same; (iii) interest and amortization of funds borrowed by Landlord, whether secured or unsecured, and other financing costs; (iv) depreciation of the Building; (v) leasing commissions; (vi) costs, fines, interest, penalties, legal fees or costs of litigation incurred due to the late payments of taxes, utility bills and other costs incurred by Landlord's failure to make such payments when due; (vii) costs incurred (less cost of recovery) for any items to the extent covered by a manufacturer's, materialmen's, vendor's or contractor's warranty; (viii) income, excess profits, franchise taxes or other such taxes imposed on or measured by the income of Landlord from the operation of the Building; (ix) costs of Landlord's defense of lawsuits against Landlord and any judgments or costs of settlement; (x) legal fees and other costs (including prepayment of any indebtedness) incurred in connection with any mortgaging, financing, refinancing, sale, change of ownership or entering into or extending or modifying any financing, 5
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will not be responsible for the listed items, reducing its CAM exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Caps annual increase of controllable operating expenses at 5%.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance) shall not increase by more than five percent (5%) annually following Tenant's Base Year.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Limits tenant’s exposure to uncontrollable inflation in controllable CAM items to a maximum 5% per year.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays monthly Additional Rent for estimated annual increases in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: For the calendar year commencing on January 1st of the first calendar year after the Base Year and for each calendar year thereafter during the Term, Landlord shall estimate the amount the Operating Expenses shall increase for such calendar year above the Operating Expenses incurred during the Base Year. Landlord shall send to Tenant a written statement of the amount of Tenant's Proportionate Share of any estimated increase in Operating Expenses and Tenant shall pay to Landlord, monthly as Additional Rent, Tenant's prorata share of such increase in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must make monthly payments for projected increases, providing predictable cash flow but obligating payment before actual reconciliation.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Annual reconciliation of actual Operating Expenses with a 30‑day payment window.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Within ninety (90) days after the end of each calendar year, Landlord shall send an annual statement of Operating Expenses, which shall be accounted for and reported in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (the "Annual Statement") to Tenant. Pursuant to the Annual Statement, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Additional Rent in a lump sum as owed or Landlord shall adjust Tenant's Rent payments if Landlord owes Tenant a credit, such payment or adjustment to be made within thirty (30) days after the Annual Statement is received by Tenant.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reconcile and pay any outstanding amount or receive a rent adjustment within 30 days of receiving the Annual Statement.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Base Year for CAM calculations as 2016.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: The term "Operating Expense" as used herein means ... The term "Base Year" for tax and operating expense calculations is defined as the calendar year 2016.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant’s CAM calculations reference the 2016 Base Year for comparisons and adjustments.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Controllable Operating Expenses as all except taxes and insurance.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance)
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Clarifies which expenses are subject to the 5% cap and which are non‑controllable.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses Landlord for any underpayment of its proportionate share of operating expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall promptly reimburse Landlord for any underpayment of Tenant's Proportionate Share of such Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay Landlord for any shortfall in its CAM payment, potentially increasing cash flow obligations.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: If operating expenses overstatement exceeds 5%, Landlord reimburses tenant for audit cost.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: In the event that Tenant's Review indicates that Operating Expenses were overstated by more than five percent (5%}, then Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for the reasonable cost of such audit.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Repairs to roof, foundation, and structural components are excluded from operating expenses and tenant CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific repairs under CAM, reducing potential liability.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays $50 per hour for maintenance personnel when issue is tenant‑responsible.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord shall charge, and Tenant shall pay, fifty dollars ($50.00) per hour, with a one hour minimum, for work performed by such personnel.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant incurs additional hourly charges for maintenance work it is responsible for, adding to operating cost exposure.

keyTenantProtections: Clear proportionate share calculation
Tenant's right to inspect excess tax books within 180 days
Tenant’s right to recover audit costs if overstatement >5%
keyTenantExposures: Limited audit rights for operating expenses
Incomplete adjustment language for operating expenses

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant's proportionate share equals the Premises rentable square feet divided by the total Building rentable square feet, as adjusted per the Premises paragraph.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage:
Share
Broker or Agent:
rentable square feet in the Premises by (ii) the 226,468 total rentable square feet
in the Building. Tenant's Proportionate Share shall be adjusted in accordance with
the Premises paragraph above.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will pay CAM expenses based on this calculated share of the Building’s rentable square footage.

Pursuant to the Annual Statement, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Additional Rent in a lump sum as owed or Landlord shall adjust Tenant's Rent payments if Landlord owes Tenant a credit, such payment or adjustment to be made within thirty (30) days after the Annual Statement is received by Tenant.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reconcile and pay any outstanding amount or receive a rent adjustment within 30 days of receiving the Annual Statement.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Base Year for CAM calculations as 2016.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: The term "Operating Expense" as used herein means ... The term "Base Year" for tax and operating expense calculations is defined as the calendar year 2016.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant’s CAM calculations reference the 2016 Base Year for comparisons and adjustments.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Controllable Operating Expenses as all except taxes and insurance.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance)
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Clarifies which expenses are subject to the 5% cap and which are non‑controllable.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses Landlord for any underpayment of its proportionate share of operating expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall promptly reimburse Landlord for any underpayment of Tenant's Proportionate Share of such Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay Landlord for any shortfall in its CAM payment, potentially increasing cash flow obligations.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: If operating expenses overstatement exceeds 5%, Landlord reimburses tenant for audit cost.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: In the event that Tenant's Review indicates that Operating Expenses were overstated by more than five percent (5%}, then Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for the reasonable cost of such audit.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Repairs to roof, foundation, and structural components are excluded from operating expenses and tenant CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific repairs under CAM, reducing potential liability.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays $50 per hour for maintenance personnel when issue is tenant‑responsible.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord shall charge, and Tenant shall pay, fifty dollars ($50.00) per hour, with a one hour minimum, for work performed by such personnel.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant incurs additional hourly charges for maintenance work it is responsible for, adding to operating cost exposure.

keyTenantProtections: Clear proportionate share calculation
Tenant's right to inspect excess tax books within 180 days
Tenant’s right to recover audit costs if overstatement >5%
keyTenantExposures: Limited audit rights for operating expenses
Incomplete adjustment language for operating expenses

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant's proportionate share equals the Premises rentable square feet divided by the total Building rentable square feet, as adjusted per the Premises paragraph.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage:
Share
Broker or Agent:
rentable square feet in the Premises by (ii) the 226,468 total rentable square feet
in the Building. Tenant's Proportionate Share shall be adjusted in accordance with
the Premises paragraph above.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will pay CAM expenses based on this calculated share of the Building’s rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses landlord for excess real property taxes over the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord agrees to pay all real property taxes and special assessments (collectively referred to herein as "Taxes") that accrue against the Premises, and/or the Land and/or improvements of which the Premises are a part. Property taxes incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the taxes on the property during the "Base Year" will be passed through to building tenants based on a pro‑rata square footage basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay the portion of any property tax that exceeds the 2016 Base Year amount, proportional to the tenant’s share of rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant liable for personal property/fixtures taxes paid by landlord upon demand.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall be liable for all taxes levied or assessed against any personal property or fixtures placed in the Premises. If any such taxes are levied or assessed against Landlord or Landlord's property and (i) Landlord pays the same or (ii) the assessed value of Landlord's property is increased by inclusion of such personal property and fixtures and Landlord pays the increased taxes, then, upon demand Tenant shall pay to Landlord such taxes.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reimburse landlord for any taxes on personal property or fixtures that landlord pays for, upon demand.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays excess operating expenses above the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Operating expenses (as defined herein) incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the operating expenses on the Building for the Base Year (2016) (the \"Base Year\"\') will be passed through to the Building tenants on a prorata basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is responsible for its proportional share of any operating expenses that exceed the 2016 Base Year amount.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant may inspect books of excess property tax invoices within 180 days.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall have a right to inspect the books and records of the property within one hundred eighty (180) days of receipt of such invoice with respect to such account.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant has a limited audit window for reviewing tax pass‑through invoices, after which rights are waived.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Excludes a list of expenses from tenant's CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Operating Expenses shall not include any of the following: (i) expenses for capital improvements except as expressly provided in this Section 4; (ii) costs (in excess of Landlord's insurance deductible) of repairs, restoration, replacements or other work occasioned by fire, windstorm or other casualty of an insurable nature (whether such destruction be total or partial), or the negligence or intentional tort of Landlord, or any subsidiary or affiliate of Landlord, or any representative, employee or agent of same; (iii) interest and amortization of funds borrowed by Landlord, whether secured or unsecured, and other financing costs; (iv) depreciation of the Building; (v) leasing commissions; (vi) costs, fines, interest, penalties, legal fees or costs of litigation incurred due to the late payments of taxes, utility bills and other costs incurred by Landlord's failure to make such payments when due; (vii) costs incurred (less cost of recovery) for any items to the extent covered by a manufacturer's, materialmen's, vendor's or contractor's warranty; (viii) income, excess profits, franchise taxes or other such taxes imposed on or measured by the income of Landlord from the operation of the Building; (ix) costs of Landlord's defense of lawsuits against Landlord and any judgments or costs of settlement; (x) legal fees and other costs (including prepayment of any indebtedness) incurred in connection with any mortgaging, financing, refinancing, sale, change of ownership or entering into or extending or modifying any financing, 5
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will not be responsible for the listed items, reducing its CAM exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Caps annual increase of controllable operating expenses at 5%.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance) shall not increase by more than five percent (5%) annually following Tenant's Base Year.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Limits tenant’s exposure to uncontrollable inflation in controllable CAM items to a maximum 5% per year.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays monthly Additional Rent for estimated annual increases in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: For the calendar year commencing on January 1st of the first calendar year after the Base Year and for each calendar year thereafter during the Term, Landlord shall estimate the amount the Operating Expenses shall increase for such calendar year above the Operating Expenses incurred during the Base Year. Landlord shall send to Tenant a written statement of the amount of Tenant's Proportionate Share of any estimated increase in Operating Expenses and Tenant shall pay to Landlord, monthly as Additional Rent, Tenant's prorata share of such increase in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must make monthly payments for projected increases, providing predictable cash flow but obligating payment before actual reconciliation.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Annual reconciliation of actual Operating Expenses with a 30‑day payment window.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Within ninety (90) days after the end of each calendar year, Landlord shall send an annual statement of Operating Expenses, which shall be accounted for and reported in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (the "Annual Statement") to Tenant. Pursuant to the Annual Statement, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Additional Rent in a lump sum as owed or Landlord shall adjust Tenant's Rent payments if Landlord owes Tenant a credit, such payment or adjustment to be made within thirty (30) days after the Annual Statement is received by Tenant.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reconcile and pay any outstanding amount or receive a rent adjustment within 30 days of receiving the Annual Statement.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses landlord for excess real property taxes over the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord agrees to pay all real property taxes and special assessments (collectively referred to herein as "Taxes") that accrue against the Premises, and/or the Land and/or improvements of which the Premises are a part. Property taxes incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the taxes on the property during the "Base Year" will be passed through to building tenants based on a pro‑rata square footage basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay the portion of any property tax that exceeds the 2016 Base Year amount, proportional to the tenant’s share of rentable square footage.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant liable for personal property/fixtures taxes paid by landlord upon demand.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall be liable for all taxes levied or assessed against any personal property or fixtures placed in the Premises. If any such taxes are levied or assessed against Landlord or Landlord's property and (i) Landlord pays the same or (ii) the assessed value of Landlord's property is increased by inclusion of such personal property and fixtures and Landlord pays the increased taxes, then, upon demand Tenant shall pay to Landlord such taxes.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reimburse landlord for any taxes on personal property or fixtures that landlord pays for, upon demand.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays excess operating expenses above the Base Year on a pro‑rata basis.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Operating expenses (as defined herein) incurred in any year during the lease term which exceed the operating expenses on the Building for the Base Year (2016) (the \"Base Year\"\') will be passed through to the Building tenants on a prorata basis.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is responsible for its proportional share of any operating expenses that exceed the 2016 Base Year amount.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant may inspect the books of excess property tax invoices within 180 days.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall have a right to inspect the books and records of the property within one hundred eighty (180) days of receipt of such invoice with respect to such account.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant has a limited audit window for reviewing tax pass‑through invoices, after which rights are waived.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Excludes a list of expenses from tenant's CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Notwithstanding anything in this Lease to the contrary, Operating Expenses shall not include any of the following: (i) expenses for capital improvements except as expressly provided in this Section 4; (ii) costs (in excess of Landlord's insurance deductible) of repairs, restoration, replacements or other work occasioned by fire, windstorm or other casualty of an insurable nature (whether such destruction be total or partial), or the negligence or intentional tort of Landlord, or any subsidiary or affiliate of Landlord, or any representative, employee or agent of same; (iii) interest and amortization of funds borrowed by Landlord, whether secured or unsecured, and other financing costs; (iv) depreciation of the Building; (v) leasing commissions; (vi) costs, fines, interest, penalties, legal fees or costs of litigation incurred due to the late payments of taxes, utility bills and other costs incurred by Landlord's failure to make such payments when due; (vii) costs incurred (less cost of recovery) for any items to the extent covered by a manufacturer's, materialmen's, vendor's or contractor's warranty; (viii) income, excess profits, franchise taxes or other such taxes imposed on or measured by the income of Landlord from the operation of the Building; (ix) costs of Landlord's defense of lawsuits against Landlord and any judgments or costs of settlement; (x) legal fees and other costs (including prepayment of any indebtedness) incurred in connection with any mortgaging, financing, refinancing, sale, change of ownership or entering into or extending or modifying any financing, 5
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant will not be responsible for the listed items, reducing its CAM exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Caps annual increase of controllable operating expenses at 5%.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance) shall not increase by more than five percent (5%) annually following Tenant's Base Year.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Limits tenant’s exposure to uncontrollable inflation in controllable CAM items to a maximum 5% per year.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays monthly Additional Rent for estimated annual increases in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: For the calendar year commencing on January 1st of the first calendar year after the Base Year and for each calendar year thereafter during the Term, Landlord shall estimate the amount the Operating Expenses shall increase for such calendar year above the Operating Expenses incurred during the Base Year. Landlord shall send to Tenant a written statement of the amount of Tenant's Proportionate Share of any estimated increase in Operating Expenses and Tenant shall pay to Landlord, monthly as Additional Rent, Tenant's prorata share of such increase in Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must make monthly payments for projected increases, providing predictable cash flow but obligating payment before actual reconciliation.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Annual reconciliation of actual Operating Expenses with a 30‑day payment window.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Within ninety (90) days after the end of each calendar year, Landlord shall send an annual statement of Operating Expenses, which shall be accounted for and reported in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (the "Annual Statement") to Tenant. Pursuant to the Annual Statement, Tenant shall pay to Landlord Additional Rent in a lump sum as owed or Landlord shall adjust Tenant's Rent payments if Landlord owes Tenant a credit, such payment or adjustment to be made within thirty (30) days after the Annual Statement is received by Tenant.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must reconcile and pay any outstanding amount or receive a rent adjustment within 30 days of receiving the Annual Statement.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Base Year for CAM calculations as 2016.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: The term "Operating Expense" as used herein means ... The term "Base Year" for tax and operating expense calculations is defined as the calendar year 2016.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant’s CAM calculations reference the 2016 Base Year for comparisons and adjustments.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Defines Controllable Operating Expenses as all except taxes and insurance.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Controllable Operating Expenses (defined as all Operating Expenses other than property taxes and insurance)
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Clarifies which expenses are subject to the 5% cap and which are non‑controllable.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant reimburses Landlord for any underpayment of its proportionate share of operating expenses.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Tenant shall promptly reimburse Landlord for any underpayment of Tenant's Proportionate Share of such Operating Expenses.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant must pay Landlord for any shortfall in its CAM payment, potentially increasing cash flow obligations.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: If operating expenses overstatement exceeds 5%, Landlord reimburses tenant for audit cost.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: In the event that Tenant's Review indicates that Operating Expenses were overstated by more than five percent (5%}, then Landlord shall reimburse Tenant for the reasonable cost of such audit.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant can recover audit costs when overstatement is >5%, limiting audit expense exposure.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Repairs to roof, foundation, and structural components are excluded from operating expenses and tenant CAM obligations.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord, at its expense and not as part of Operating Expenses shall be responsible only for repair and replacement of the roof, foundation, the exterior walls of the Building, interior structural walls, all structural components, common areas of the Building, grounds, walkways, windows, and the Building Systems, reasonable wear and tear excluded.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant is relieved from paying for these specific repairs under CAM, reducing potential liability.

allExtractedRules.ruleSummary: Tenant pays $50 per hour for maintenance personnel when issue is tenant‑responsible.
allExtractedRules.exactLanguage: Landlord shall charge, and Tenant shall pay, fifty dollars ($50.00) per hour, with a one hour minimum, for work performed by such personnel.
allExtractedRules.tenantImpact: Tenant incurs additional hourly charges for maintenance work it is responsible for, adding to operating cost exposure.
